resources.string:
Inputs required
• Function
• Initial interval
• Precision
Inputs required\n\u2022 System of 3 linear equations\n\u2022 Precision

Inputs required
• Ordinary differential equation
• Initial values
• Step size
• Value of x to find y at
• Precision

Inputs required
• xᵢ values
• yᵢ values
• Value to interpolate at

Inputs required
• Function to integrate
• Integration limits
• Number of steps

Inputs required
• xᵢ values
• yᵢ values
• Value to differentiate at
Tips\n\u2022 Function\'s variable must be x\n\u2022 Use brackets to separate terms
Tip\n\u2022 The number you want to find reciprocal of
Tips\n\u2022 Must be very near to correct answer\n\u2022 Example: 0.01, if correct answer is 0.01449
Tips\n\u2022 Separate elements in a row by space\n\u2022 Next row on new line
Tips\n\u2022 Separate elements in a row by space\n\u2022 Next row on new line
Tips\n\u2022 Function\'s variables must be x & y\n\u2022 Use brackets to separate terms

Tips
• Steps (integer)
• Integration limits
• Syntax: n, a -> b
Finding reciprocal? Please use the switch provided at input :)
Answer did not converge at given precision
Why does the function input say invalid syntax?
The variable must be as said in the tip/hint/label
There is NO implicit multiplication. Writing like \"2x\" or \"(x)(y)\" will not work. Use asterisks (*) wherever needed
Wrap terms in brackets and use as many brackets as you can inside terms
Value passed into trigonometric or logarithmic functions must be wrapped in brackets

Functions:
Trigonometric: as they are
Logarithmic:
Natural log (base e): ln(x)
Common log (base 10): log10(x)

The calculations will be shown with input value + 1 digits after decimal point. Final answer will be considered when after decimal point, input value digits are same. If you don\'t get any of this, just input whatever precision is given in question.
Answer did not converge at given precision. What?

If you just saw this, there are two possible reasons: 
1. The values that were being calculated at every iteration didn't converge at all, or 
2. It may happen that, after certain iterations, the values keep re-appearing at every second step 
In both cases, a maximum of 50 iterations will be displayed. 
If 2nd case, try some other precision value. 
If 1st case, check whether your inputs are correct and the root really lies in given interval.
Just like you do on paper. Separate elements in a row by spaces, and next row goes on new line. Make sure there are no trailing spaces/newlines at the end of row/input.
How to input system of equations?
You don\'t need to type the variables of system. The input is a 3x4 matrix of 3 coefficients (and the RHS constant) where each row accounts for an equation.
Which Runge-Kutta method is used in this app?
Doing a quick Google search results in various methods, so the one used in this app can be viewed at Info page.
You can find correctly working inputs at Info page. For any and all bug-reports or suggestions, contact me from the About section.\nThank you for using this app :)

• Added whole bunch of methods 
• Removed the run method buttons, cards themselves are clickable now 
• Stopped keyboard from auto-opening when a method is opened 
• Close keyboard when enter is pressed after last input of any method
